message.content:
cs.LO, cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.SE

The paper deals with the problem of controlling information sharing in distributed systems, which is a common concern in computer security (cs.CR) and privacy (cs.LO). The paper introduces a subcalculus of the pi-calculus, which is a formal language for describing concurrent processes (cs.PL). The paper also discusses examples of privacy notions, such as group creation and name hiding, which are relevant to distributed computing (cs.DC) and software engineering (cs.SE).
